The above date has little or no signifigance...unless you've lived in Western New York during that time. This day marks the 29th anniversary of the Great Blizzard of 1977 that crippled the City of Buffalo, NY and Western New York and the upper Finger Lakes Region, was responsible for numerous (I believe 7) fatalities, and was beleived to be the downfall of Mayor Stanley Makowski. If you lived, visited, or were just passing through during the blizzard, what memories do you have, or what memories of other weather-related encounters do you have?
